thread.title: Ethics Committee fixes November 4 for Techiman City, Wa African bribery case
thread.title_full: Ethics Committee fixes November 4 for Techiman City, Wa African bribery case

title: Ethics Committee fixes November 4 for Techiman City, Wa African bribery case
text:
Sports News | 13 October 2015 22:42 CET Ethics Committee fixes November 4 for Techiman City, Wa African bribery case By Ghana FA 
The Ethics Committee will hear the alleged bribery and match fixing case between Techiman City and Wa African United on Wednesday November 4. 
The Committee had to adjourn its last sitting on the case due to absence of the CEO of Wa African United. 
The President of Techiman City Mr. Charles Ntim's request to travel outside the country for three weeks was also taken into consideration in arriving at the new date for the sitting. 
The investigation process was initiated after Wa African United petitioned the GFA with allegations of bribery and alleged match fixing against the President of Techiman City FC. Sports News Follow Us A man can only be carefull until he buys a new car and a white shirt. By: Obidee Aba
